improve.

a rapid surprise attack on an enemy by troops, aircraft, or other armed forces.

cells, tissue or bacteria grown under laboratory conditions for scientific or medical use.

large amount of snow, rock or ice that suddenly slides down a mountain.

set amount or dose needed to satisfy a drug addict's need (e.g., drug addicts looking for a fix, a chocoholics's daily dose of chocolate).

the way sb is raised, a child's early education and care which affects its later development.

area of rising or falling ground (e.g., a hill or slope).
giving advice or warning about sth.
hobby, leisure-time means of amusement.
strong protective outer covering over the front of the eye.

be in a fix: raise (raised) vs. arise (arose) vs. arouse (aroused) vs. rise (rose)
1. raise: move to a higher position.|2. arise: appear, occur.|3. arouse: cause a particular feeling or attitude/wake sb from sleep.|4. rise: to come or go upwards, reach a higher level.
natural home of an animal or plant.
be crowded with or full of sth in great numbers.
growing strong and healthy, flourishing.
small, thin branch.
finger joint.
1. a series of legal actions used to settle a dispute or disagreemment.|2. a document that records things said or done at a meeting of a society or organization.
large number of people or vechicles that come one after the other, esp. as part of a ceremony (a march).
money or profit made from the sale of sth or an event (revenue).
face and attempt to deal with sth/sb.
very open and wide.
(of people) the talent of solving problems in a clever or original way, (of things) cleverness of design.
(of actions) having or producing a clear result or conclusion.
bullets, gunpowder, or other things that can explode or be fired from a gun.
old-fashioned and not suitable for modern needs.
old and valuable.
sth or sb that seems to belong to the past and not the present.
happening sooner than normal or at the wrong time.
find or obtain.
